ygData.subject: RE: Oasis Warning
ygData.msgSnippet: Seems to me that Verant is widening the gap between your average players (like me) who used to enjoy playing EQ, and the POWERlevelers, who now have a
ygData.messageBody:
Seems to me that Verant is widening the gap between your average players
(like me) who "used" to enjoy playing EQ, and the POWERlevelers, who now
have a distinct advantage. Not only can they successfully keep other
lower- to mid-level players from camping nice spawn spots (aviak guards
in Lake Rathe comes to mind), but now they have a new creature to hunt.
The rest of us will have to move over to make room for the exodus of
mid-level players running for their lives out of Oasis.

BEGIN RANT:
If Verant wants to nix camping, they should make more lower- to
mid-level mobs, and then restrict the server to 1,000 players. Would
that be so difficult to do? As for the incredibly insane camping that
goes on in places like Najena (for the journeyman boots), I really don't
know how to address that. As it stands now, though, I am certain that
unless I buy a pair off EBay or in-game, I will never own them. I can't
afford to spend one to two weeks camped for 18 hours a day, fighting the
kill/loot stealers. And that's NOT sour grapes. That's just how it is,
friends and neighbors. And for those of you who have the boots and will
swear to me that it took you only a day to get them, I congratulate you
on your accomplishment.
END RANT

Saidinn D'iniluki
Dark Elf Cleric
Karana Server

-----Original Message-----
From: curtis bennett [mailto:die_kluge@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 28, 1999 11:23 AM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Oasis Warning


From: "curtis bennett" <die_kluge@...>

Yea... so much for hunting in Oasis now. Jeez.


>Thanks for the info...
>
>Qanin SkyWanderer
>The Rathe 22nd Circle
>
> > ----------
> > From: Azor[SMTP:jmaynus@...]
> > Reply To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com

> > I read on another post that with the new patch they did a few changes
>with
> > the Oasis.
> > This is what the post said
> >
> > "Ok new news on this one... if anyone has hunted there before you know
>the
> > typical problems of avoiding sand giant, spectres, and sometimes
> > Tarantualla
> > whatever his name is. Well they are chicken feed.
> >
> > As of patch we now have deepwater goblins. Shamans over 35+ with the
>wolf
> > pets running around the beach of Oasis. Are they aggressive? YES Are
>they
> > strong? HELL YES
> >
> > Last night I witnessed one clean the beach between 2nd and 1st rock,
>then
> > kill a SAND GIANT and go back to the water for a swim. Apparently the
>Gods
> > have decided they did not appreciate our camping along the beach. Party
> > time
> > is over.
> >
> > They also added cistern asps. No biggie probably 14th level or so."
> >
> > So if this is 100% true and you're around Lvl 35 or lower you might
>wanna
> > be
> > extra careful there.
> >
> > **************************
> > Azor
